zh.heroTagline: 物理智能开源数据平台
zh.heroDesc:
全球首个AI自主决策自然实验室启航，
L4-L5全自动驾驶挑战张家界天门山九十九道弯，让AI在大自然中理解物理世界
zh.aboutText:
在天门山 99 道弯,Hitch Open 正创造自动驾驶的 AlphaGo 时刻。

10.77 公里的天路,1100 米的落差,99 个弯道——
F1 传奇车手 Romain Dumas 曾以 7'38"585 刷新人类极限。

而今年,清华大学 AI 赛车在无 GPS、低能见度、湿滑赛面的极限环境中,
以 16'10"838 全程自动驾驶登顶,
让 AI 首次在真实世界完成"感知—决策—行动"的闭环。

这一刻,物理智能的引擎被彻底点燃。
zh.recordsTeam1: 法国 F1 赛车手 Romain Dumas
zh.recordsTeam2: 清华大学 极限竞速战队
zh.missionTitle: Hitch Open以竞速之名,开启物理智能时代
zh.missionSubtitle: Hitch Open世界AI竞速锦标赛,以真实极限环境验证人工智能的感知与决策能力,推动AI从虚拟智能迈向物理智能。
zh.mission1Text: Hitch Open联合清华大学、复旦大学、浙江大学、湖南大学等高校，让学生在真实山路极限环境中完成AI系统研发与实车测试，成为物理智能时代的创新实践课堂。
zh.mission2Text: 通过天门山"无GPS、低能见度、多弯急坡"场景，验证AI算法在感知、决策、控制等环节的可靠性，加速物理AI从实验室走向真实世界。
zh.mission3Text: 依托中国电信5G-A网络与天翼云算力，赛事单场产生超3 TB真实物理数据，构建全球开放的物理智能数据平台，推动智能驾驶、文旅科技等产业地。
zh.mission4Text: 以公开竞赛与数据开源机制为标准，联合政府、科研、产业和投资界，检验AI安全性与产业可行性，为新质生产力与物理智能治理提供中国样本。
zh.impactSublabel1: Hitch Open 决赛期间现场观众总数
zh.impactLabel2: 主流媒体报道触达人数
zh.impactSublabel2: 各大官方及门户媒体累计触达规模
zh.mediaStatText1: 28 家国家级与行业主流媒体联合发声
zh.mediaStatText2: 全网曝光 5000 万+，互动量突破 1600 万+
zh.mediaStatText3: 清华、复旦、上交等 6 所高校官方矩阵报道，覆盖 100 万+ 青年科技受众
zh.mediaStatText4: 新华社、上海证券报、钛媒体、央视体育等 7 家头部媒体深度剖析 AI 物理智能价值
zh.mediaStatText5: 新华社英文版、China Daily 等多家海外媒体转发报道
zh.partnersSocial: 官方社交媒体合作平台
zh.trackTitle: 2025 决赛场地 - 天门山 99 道弯
zh.trackDescription: 天门山99道弯，被誉为"通天大道"，是全球最极限、最壮观的山路之一。大道两侧绝壁千仞，空谷幽深，180度急弯此消彼长。这里将成为AI竞速技术的终极试炼场，重新定义AI竞速的极限。
zh.trackImageDesc: 天门山99道弯，被誉为"通天大道"，是全球最极限的山路之一。全长逾10公里，180度急弯此消彼长。这里将成为AI竞速技术的终极试炼场，重新定义AI竞速的极限。

en.heroDesc:
The world's first natural-environment AI autonomy laboratory launches.
Fully autonomous L4–L5 driving takes on Tianmen Mountain's legendary 99 Bends—challenging AI to understand and act within the real physical world.
en.aboutTitle: The AlphaGo Moment for Physical Intelligence
en.aboutText:
On Tianmen Mountain's iconic 99 Bends, Hitch Open is defining the AlphaGo moment for autonomous driving.

A 10.77-km ascent, 1,100 meters of vertical change, and 99 technical corners—
F1 legend Romain Dumas once set the human benchmark with a 7'38"585 run.

This year, Tsinghua University's AI racecar completed a full autonomous summit run in 16'10"838
under extreme conditions with no GPS, low visibility, and slick surfaces—
marking the first time AI has achieved a complete 'perception–decision–action' loop in the real world.

This is the ignition point for the era of Physical Intelligence.
en.missionTitle: Racing Into the Physical Intelligence Era
en.missionSubtitle: The Hitch Open World AI Racing Championship tests AI perception, planning, and control in real-world extreme environments—accelerating the shift from virtual intelligence to physical intelligence.
en.mission1Text: Partnering with Tsinghua University, Fudan University, Zhejiang University, Hunan University and more, Hitch Open places students in real mountain-road environments to develop and validate full-stack autonomous systems—becoming a new hands-on classroom for physical intelligence.
en.mission2Text: Tianmen Mountain's conditions—no GPS, low visibility, steep gradients, and tight hairpins—serve as a real-world stress test for perception, planning, and control algorithms, accelerating the maturity of physical-world AI.
en.mission3Text: Powered by China Telecom's 5G-A network and cloud infrastructure, each event generates over 3 TB of real-world physical data. This forms an open-source data platform that fuels innovation in autonomous driving, tourism technology, and beyond.
en.mission4Text: With open competition and transparent data-sharing standards, Hitch Open unites government, academia, industry, and investment sectors to verify AI safety and real-world feasibility—establishing a new model for physical intelligence governance.
en.impactSublabel1: Total attendance during the Hitch Open Finals
en.impactSublabel2: Total audience reached across major national and digital media
en.impactSublabel3: Highest trending peak on event day
en.mediaStatText1: 28 national and industry-leading outlets reported on the event
en.mediaStatText3: Coverage from six leading universities, reaching over one million young tech audiences
en.mediaStatText4: Seven top-tier media organizations, such as Xinhua News Agency, Shanghai Securities News, TMTPost, and CCTV Sports, have provided in-depth examinations of the value of AI physical intelligence
en.mediaStatText5: International coverage from Xinhua English, China Daily, and more
en.trackSubtitle: The Ultimate Arena for AI Racing
en.trackDescription: Known globally as the 'Avenue to the Sky,' Tianmen Mountain's 99 Bends is one of the world's most dramatic and technically demanding mountain roads. With sheer cliffs, deep valleys, and continuous hairpins, it stands as the ultimate proving ground for next-generation AI racing technologies.
en.trackImageDesc: The legendary 99 Bends stretch over 10 kilometers, with continuous 180° hairpins. This iconic mountain road serves as the definitive testbed for AI racing, pushing the limits of physical intelligence.
